title: Alan Dixon up for re-election at Evans Dixon AGM
text:
On November 11, Alan Dixon will go to meet his makers.

That is, the 82 per cent of the register he doesn't personally own. Alone among Evans Dixon's four directors, he drew the short-straw of being up for re-election at this year's annual general meeting.

Alan Dixon was until October 3 the group CEO. Trevor Collens

It must be a terrifying prospect. This is a tightly-held company, so we don't think he's in any real danger, but Evans Dixon does have a lot of unhappy clients. We wouldn't be surprised if directors have to cross a gauntlet of cranky retirees to take their seats at the head table.

And especially unfortunately for Dixon, most of the problems in the newly-listed tie-up of Evans and Partners and Dixon Advisory have come from the Dixon Advisory part of the business.

Dixon was until October 3 the group CEO. While stepping down, he signalled he'd remain as a non-executive director, but wouldn't draw a salary for it, forfeiting his $175,000-a-year director fee from that point on.
